body: Curious what do you mean `broken functions` in 0.8.0? Just tested with the above spec, not seeing errors though.
@Simon-Li, he probably means the fact that the `Workspace` property isn't (de)serialized.

@casualjim what's actually the reason that you added an explicit Marshal-/UnmarshalJSON function in v0.8.0 (https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/commit/de870963a73dd4cc2f2d11d0099e51b26eb33020)? In what cases was the implicit version not good enough?

For composed objects there might also be inheritance involved etc. At first glance I don't know why the custom marshaller was triggered because there is no discriminator involved.
 
In the future it would be nice to generate custom marshal/unmarshal methods for every generated struct using https://github.com/mailru/easyjson
@GlenDC Yes, that's what I meant.  Thanks for clarifying.  I totally missed that I didn't say how it was broken.

@casualjim but AFAIK the default marshaller works fine with inheritance, did a play ground test before asking my previous question to be sure. Can you give a situation where the implicit marshaler wouldn't work?
when a discriminator is involved because then you have only an interface and it needs to be able to marshal a concrete type

[Update: I just realized this may be a related but different issue, since it's in 0.7.4]
[Update2: and this issue has been fixed in 0.8.0: `if err != nil && err != io.EOF`]

Looks like this "use the polymorphic marshal" is triggered by the type having a property that is a parametric type or an array of a polymorphic type:

```yaml
  Values:
    type: "object"
    properties:
      Value:
        $ref: "#/definitions/Value"
      Array:
        type: "array"
        items:
          $ref: "#/definitions/Value"

  Value:
    type: "object"
    discriminator: "ValueType"
    required:
    - "ValueType"
    properties:
      ValueType:
        type: "string"

  ValueNumber:
    allOf:
    - $ref: "#/definitions/Value"
    - required:
      - "Value"
      properties:
        Value:
          type: "number"
```

This function is failing because I only set one or the other of `Array` or `Value` (since Swagger doesn't have `anyOf` yet), and this returns an error at the read of `Value` when it isn't provided.  It checks to see if `Array` is there before it tries to read it, but not `Value`.

```go
// UnmarshalJSON unmarshals this object with a polymorphic type from a JSON structure
func (m *Values) UnmarshalJSON(raw []byte) error {
	var data struct {
		Array json.RawMessage `json:"Array,omitempty"`

		Value json.RawMessage `json:"Value,omitempty"`
	}

	buf := bytes.NewBuffer(raw)
	dec := json.NewDecoder(buf)
	dec.UseNumber()

	if err := dec.Decode(&data); err != nil {
		return err
	}

	var array []Value

	buf = bytes.NewBuffer(raw)
	dec = json.NewDecoder(buf)
	dec.UseNumber()

	untypedObj := make(map[string]interface{})
	if err := dec.Decode(&untypedObj); err != nil {
		return err
	}
	if untypedArray, ok := untypedObj["Array"]; ok {
		if slcArray, ok := untypedArray.([]interface{}); ok {
			for _, slcEl := range slcArray {
				slcJSON, _ := json.Marshal(slcEl)
				slcObj, err := UnmarshalValue(bytes.NewBuffer(slcJSON), runtime.JSONConsumer())
				if err != nil {
					return err
				}
				array = append(array, slcObj)
			}
		}
	}

	value, err := UnmarshalValue(bytes.NewBuffer(data.Value), runtime.JSONConsumer())
	if err != nil {
		return err
	}

	var result Values
	result.Array = array
	result.Value = value
	*m = result
	return nil
}
```

Here is the json that it's trying to unmarshal, to an array of `Values` objects:
```json
[ { "Value": { "ValueType": "ValueNumber", "Value": 2 } } ,
  { "Array": [ { "ValueType": "ValueNumber", "Value": 0 } ] } ]
```
I used the latest swagger today, and it's still broken, i.e: the properties other than allOf are not marshaled/un-marshaled.

It's broken since 71225c4a7882ae49cd57e22292a58dff382908e8.
Would some one bring this fix in?
Thanks
I created a new issue about this. https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/1042

issue.title: Missing fields in generated marshaler/unmarshaler when the object extends other objects

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

issue.body:
## Problem statement
When an object extends other objects (using `allOf`), the generated Marshaler and Unmarshaler don't handle the fields in enclosing object.

The fix to [#847](https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/847) looks good (not tested myself)

## Swagger specification
[swagger.yaml](https://github.com/yan-zhuang/swagger-allof-test/blob/master/swagger.yaml)

## Steps to reproduce
* generate server from the swagger file.
`swagger generate server`
* verify the generated `models/b.go` file.
* expecting field `F3` and `F4` are handled correctly in MarshalJSON and UnmarshalJSON methods.

## Environment
swagger version: from 71225c4a7882ae49cd57e22292a58dff382908e8 to 0.10.0 and the latest
go version: go version go1.7.1 linux/amd64 
OS:   Linux test 3.10.0-327.18.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Apr 8 05:09:53 EDT 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

issue.title: (Un)MarshalJSON functions ignore part of struct when model is generated with allOf:

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

issue.body:
## Problem statement
(When generating server)

When allOf is used, generated struct has broken marshalling, generated functions to marshal and unmarshal ignore properties part of the model.

I think related issues are:
#847 #1042  and maybe discussion in #1559

## Swagger specification
```yaml
swagger: '2.0'
info:
  title: aaa
  version: 0.0.1
  description: >-
host: 'localhost:8088'
basePath: /
schemes:
  - http
paths:
  /:
    get:
      summary: tbd
      operationId: tbd
      description: tbd
      responses:
        '204':
          description: 204 No Content
        '500':
          $ref: '#/responses/InternalServer'
responses:
  InternalServer:
    description: 500 Internal Server error
    schema:
      $ref: '#/definitions/ErrResponse'
definitions:
  JobID:
    type: integer
    format: uint64
  ArtifactType:
    type: string
    enum:
      - IMAGE
      - RESULT
      - TEST
      - YAML
  ArtifactPath:
    type: string
  ArtifactStatus:
    type: string
    enum:
      - DOWNLOADING
      - READY
      - FAILED
      - PENDING
  ArtifactURI:
    type: string
    format: uri
  ArtifactAlias:
    type: string
  ArtifactDescription:
    type: object
    properties:
      JobID:
        $ref: '#/definitions/JobID'
      Type:
        $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactType'
      Alias:
        $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactAlias'
      URI:
        $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactURI'
  ArtifactInfo:
    type: object
    allOf:
     - $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactDescription'
    properties:
      Path:
        $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactPath'
      Status:
        $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactStatus'
      Timestamp:
        type: string
        format: date-time
  ErrResponse:
    type: object
    properties:
      type:
        type: string
      message:
        type: string
```

results in code:
```go
// ArtifactInfo describes single artifact stored in ArtifactDB.
// swagger:model ArtifactInfo
type ArtifactInfo struct {
	ArtifactDescription

	// path
	Path ArtifactPath `json:"Path,omitempty"`

	// status
	Status ArtifactStatus `json:"Status,omitempty"`

	// is date of creating the artifact.
	// Format: date-time
	Timestamp strfmt.DateTime `json:"Timestamp,omitempty"`
}

// UnmarshalJSON unmarshals this object from a JSON structure
func (m *ArtifactInfo) UnmarshalJSON(raw []byte) error {
	// AO0
	var aO0 ArtifactDescription
	if err := swag.ReadJSON(raw, &aO0); err != nil {
		return err
	}
	m.ArtifactDescription = aO0

	return nil
}

// MarshalJSON marshals this object to a JSON structure
func (m ArtifactInfo) MarshalJSON() ([]byte, error) {
	_parts := make([][]byte, 0, 1)

	aO0, err := swag.WriteJSON(m.ArtifactDescription)
	if err != nil {
		return nil, err
	}
	_parts = append(_parts, aO0)

	return swag.ConcatJSON(_parts...), nil
}
```



## Environment
swagger version: 
checked out commit: 73498993a0a27ed9b0a063d3e94536a6a050fa22 
also on current master: 8c101dc8c12c8e25b5803a6376b7b2b7f09a622f
go version: 1.10.3  
OS:   ubuntu 16.04
